args: Does this describe a specific, new, official action or formal announcement already taken/made by the Trump administration? Answer only "yes" or "no". Trump appoints loyalists to Kennedy Center board President Donald Trump was officially elected chair of the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington on Wednesday, installing a new board of trustees as he furthers his executive authority to remake one of the nation’s premier cultural institutions. The Kennedy Center’s new board is composed of Trump loyalists, including White House Chief of Staff Susie Wiles, White House Deputy Chief of Staff Dan Scavino, second lady Usha Vance, former transportation secretary Elaine Chao and Trump himself, according to its website. “It is a Great Honor to be Chairman of The Kennedy Center, especially with this amazing Board of Trustees. We will make The Kennedy Center a very special and exciting place!” Trump posted on Truth Social, noting he was voted in as chairman unanimously. Trump’s recasting of the Kennedy Center board breaks from tradition. The arts venue has typically been led by a bipartisan board and evenly split between Democratic and Republican appointees to ensure diverse programming. On Monday on Truth Social, Trump also named former acting director of national intelligence Richard Grenell, who is serving as an envoy for special missions, as the interim executive director of the Kennedy Center.
